title: Install the game on my Windows PC
description: As a Windows PC Gamer, I want to run a simple, guided installer for Monopoly Tycoon, so that I can get the game set up on my computer quickly and without errors.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I have downloaded the installer on a supported Windows PC, when I run it and accept all default options, then the game is successfully installed to the default directory and is ready to play.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the installer is running, when the target drive has insufficient disk space, then an error message is displayed and the installation is halted.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am a standard user without admin rights, when I run the installer, then a Windows UAC prompt must appear requesting elevation to proceed.
technical_tasks: WI-034: Create Inno Setup Installer Script
definition_of_done: All ACs pass on Windows 10 & 11. Installer is a single, digitally signed .exe. A working uninstaller is created. All code (Inno Setup Script) is reviewed and merged.

title: Choose a custom installation directory
description: As a Windows PC Gamer, I want to be able to choose a custom installation directory during setup, so that I can manage my disk space and organize my applications according to my preferences.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am on the 'Choose Install Location' screen in the installer, when I select a valid custom directory on another drive, then the game files are installed into that specific directory.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am on the 'Choose Install Location' screen, when I view the UI, then the space required for the game and the space available on the selected drive are accurately displayed.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I select a drive with insufficient space, when I attempt to proceed with the installation, then an error message is displayed and the 'Next' button is disabled.
technical_tasks: WI-034: Create Inno Setup Installer Script
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The installer correctly uses the user-specified path. The disk space check is accurate and updates dynamically. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Create a desktop shortcut during installation
description: As a Windows PC Gamer, I want a checkbox option to create a desktop shortcut during installation, so that I can easily launch the game from my desktop.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the installer is running, when I leave the 'Create a desktop shortcut' option checked (default) and complete the installation, then a shortcut named 'Monopoly Tycoon' with the correct icon appears on my desktop.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the desktop shortcut has been created, when I double-click it, then the Monopoly Tycoon game application launches successfully.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am running the installer, when I uncheck the 'Create a desktop shortcut' option and complete the installation, then no shortcut is created on my desktop.
technical_tasks: WI-034: Create Inno Setup Installer Script
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The shortcut option is checked by default. The created shortcut has the correct icon and target path. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Ensure UI adapts to different monitor aspect ratios
description: As a Player, I want the game's user interface to adapt to my monitor's aspect ratio (16:9, 16:10, 21:9), so that I can have a high-quality visual experience without distorted or overlapping elements.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the game is running on a standard 16:9 display, when I view any screen (menu, HUD, dialog), then all UI elements are correctly positioned and scaled with no distortion.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the game is running on an ultrawide 21:9 display, when I view the main game screen, then the HUD elements are correctly anchored to the corners and the game board remains centered and correctly proportioned.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the game is running in windowed mode, when I resize the window, then the UI elements dynamically adjust to the new dimensions without crashing or becoming unusable.
technical_tasks: WI-018: Implement Game Setup Screen; WI-019: Implement In-Game HUD; WI-020: Implement Trading and Property Management UI; WI-021: Implement Settings Menu
definition_of_done: All ACs pass on 16:9, 16:10, and 21:9 aspect ratios. All UI screens and modals are tested. UI does not break on extreme aspect ratios (e.g., 4:3). Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Receive guidance on locating log files after an error
description: As a Player, if the game encounters a critical error, I want to be shown a clear message with a unique ID and instructions on where to find the log files, so that I can provide developers with the necessary information to fix the bug.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given an unhandled exception occurs during gameplay, when the global exception handler catches it, then a modal error dialog is displayed instead of the application crashing to the desktop.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the error dialog is displayed, when I view its content, then it contains a non-technical error message, a unique Error ID, and the full path to the log file directory.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given an error has occurred, when I check the log file, then an 'ERROR' level entry exists containing the full exception details and the same Error ID that was displayed in the dialog.
technical_tasks: WI-032: Implement Global Exception Handler
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The error dialog appears on unhandled exceptions. The error ID in the dialog correlates with the ID in the log file. The application closes gracefully from the dialog. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Uninstall the game cleanly from my computer
description: As a Windows PC Gamer, I want a standard uninstallation process to completely remove all application files, so that I can reclaim disk space and ensure my system remains clean.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the game is installed, when I uninstall it via Windows 'Apps & features', then all application files, shortcuts, and registry entries are removed.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the uninstaller is running, when I am prompted to keep or remove my personal data and I choose to KEEP it, then the application is removed but the '%APPDATA%/MonopolyTycoon' directory remains.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the uninstaller is running while the game is open, when I attempt to proceed, then an error message is displayed stating the game must be closed first.
technical_tasks: WI-034: Create Inno Setup Installer Script
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. Application files and shortcuts are completely removed. The uninstaller correctly handles the user's choice regarding personal data. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Choose to keep my personal data upon uninstallation
description: As a Player uninstalling the game, I want a clear choice to keep or delete my personal data (saves, profile), so that I can reinstall the game later without losing my progress.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am running the uninstaller and have existing save files, when I am prompted to remove personal data, then the dialog text clearly states this includes save games and profiles, and the default option is 'No' (keep data).
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I have run the uninstaller, when I choose 'No' at the data removal prompt, then the application files are removed, but the '%APPDATA%/MonopolyTycoon' directory and its contents remain untouched.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I have run the uninstaller, when I choose 'Yes' at the data removal prompt, then all application files AND the '%APPDATA%/MonopolyTycoon' directory are deleted.
technical_tasks: WI-034: Create Inno Setup Installer Script
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The uninstaller presents a clear choice with a safe default. The user's choice is correctly executed. The prompt does not appear if no user data exists. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Start a new game from the main menu
description: As a Player, I want to select a 'New Game' option from the main menu, so that I can proceed to the game setup screen and configure a new match.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am on the main menu screen, when I click the 'New Game' button, then the application transitions to the Game Setup screen.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am on the main menu, when I use the keyboard to navigate to and activate the 'New Game' button, then the application transitions to the Game Setup screen.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am on the main menu, when I click the 'New Game' button multiple times in quick succession, then the application transitions to the Game Setup screen only once, without errors.
technical_tasks: WI-018: Implement Game Setup Screen
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The transition to the Game Setup screen is smooth. The button is keyboard accessible and provides visual feedback on hover/click. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Configure a game with one to three AI opponents
description: As a Player setting up a new game, I want to select the number of AI opponents (one, two, or three), so that I can customize the game's challenge and duration.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am on the game setup screen, when I select '3' as the number of AI opponents, then the UI dynamically updates to show configuration sections for three distinct AI opponents.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am on the game setup screen, when I start the game after selecting '2' AI opponents, then a new game session is created with one human and two AI players.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am on the game setup screen, when the screen first loads, then a default number of opponents (e.g., 2) is pre-selected.
technical_tasks: WI-018: Implement Game Setup Screen
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The game correctly starts with 1, 2, or 3 AI opponents based on selection. The UI dynamically adapts to the selection. A sensible default is provided. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Set a unique difficulty for each AI opponent
description: As a Player setting up a new game, I want to independently assign a difficulty level (Easy, Medium, or Hard) to each AI opponent, so that I can create a custom-tailored challenge.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I have selected 3 AI opponents on the game setup screen, when I set their difficulties to 'Easy', 'Hard', and 'Medium' respectively, then the UI clearly displays these unique selections.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am on the game setup screen, when a new AI opponent slot is added, then its difficulty selector defaults to 'Medium'.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I have configured a game with 'Easy' and 'Hard' AI opponents, when the game starts, then the AI agents are initialized with the correct difficulty parameters, as verifiable in the logs.
technical_tasks: WI-018: Implement Game Setup Screen; WI-015: Develop AI Configuration System
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. Each AI's difficulty can be set independently. The settings are correctly passed to the game state upon starting a new game. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Create a persistent player profile
description: As a Player, I want to enter a custom name to create a personal profile, so that my game progress, statistics, and high scores are saved under my unique identity.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am on the game setup screen, when I enter a valid name (3-16 alphanumeric characters) and start the game, then a new player profile is created and persisted in the local database.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I have created a profile with the name 'CashKing', when the game starts, then my name is displayed as 'CashKing' in the in-game HUD.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I enter an invalid name (too short, too long, or with special characters), when I attempt to start the game, then a validation message is displayed and I cannot proceed.
technical_tasks: WI-018: Implement Game Setup Screen; WI-028: Setup SQLite Database and Schema
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The profile is saved to the SQLite database. The entered name is used in-game. Input validation is enforced as per requirements. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Receive feedback for an invalid profile name
description: As a Player creating a profile, I want to receive immediate and clear feedback if the name I enter is invalid, so that I can easily correct it and proceed.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am on the game setup screen, when I enter a name with fewer than 3 characters, then an error message 'Name must be at least 3 characters long' is displayed and the 'Start Game' button is disabled.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am on the game setup screen, when I enter a name with special characters (e.g., 'Player!'), then an error message 'Name can only contain letters and numbers' is displayed and the 'Start Game' button is disabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given an error message for an invalid name is displayed, when I edit the name to be valid, then the error message disappears and the 'Start Game' button becomes enabled.
technical_tasks: WI-018: Implement Game Setup Screen
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. Validation is real-time. Error messages are specific to the rule violated. Correcting the input removes the error state. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: View my persistent historical gameplay statistics
description: As a Returning Player, I want to access a screen that displays my cumulative statistics from all completed games, so that I can track my long-term performance and progression.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I have completed several games, when I select 'Player Statistics' from the main menu, then a screen is displayed with my aggregated stats like 'Total Wins', 'Win/Loss Ratio', and 'Average Game Duration'.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am a new player with no completed games, when I view the statistics screen, then all values are displayed as '0' or 'N/A' in a user-friendly way.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given my current 'Total Wins' is 2, when I win a new game, then the 'Total Wins' statistic on the screen updates to '3'.
technical_tasks: WI-029: Implement Statistics Tracking and Persistence
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The statistics screen correctly reads from and displays data from the SQLite database. Stats are updated correctly upon game completion. The screen handles the zero-data state gracefully. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Select my player token from a set of classic options
description: As a Player setting up a new game, I want to choose my game piece from a selection of classic tokens, so that I can personalize my in-game identity.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am on the game setup screen, when I click on a token (e.g., 'Top Hat'), then it becomes visually highlighted as my selection.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I have selected the 'Battleship' token and started the game, when the game board loads, then my 3D game piece on the board is the 'Battleship'.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I have selected a token and configured a 3-player game, when the game starts, then the two AI opponents are each assigned a unique token from the remaining pool.
technical_tasks: WI-018: Implement Game Setup Screen
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The UI allows selection from at least 8 classic tokens. The selected token is used in-game. AI opponents are assigned unique, non-conflicting tokens. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Roll two six-sided dice to start my move
description: As a Player whose turn it is, I want to click a button to roll two virtual dice, so that I can determine how many spaces my token will move.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given it is my turn, when I click the 'Roll Dice' button, then two random numbers (1-6) are generated and a 3D dice roll animation is played.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the 'Roll Dice' button is available, when it is not my turn to roll (e.g., it's an AI's turn), then the button is disabled and non-interactive.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the dice roll result is doubles, when my move is completed, then a 'doubles' flag is set in my player state to trigger an extra turn (as per US-017).
technical_tasks: WI-006: Implement Secure Dice Rolling
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. Dice rolls are verifiably random using a secure method. The UI button is enabled/disabled at the correct times. A polished animation provides visual feedback. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Watch my token automatically move around the board
description: As a Player, I want to see my token animate its movement space-by-space after I roll the dice, so that I can visually track my progress around the board.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I roll a total of 7, when the dice roll animation completes, then my token animates moving sequentially across 7 spaces on the board.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given my token is on 'Boardwalk' (space 39) and I roll a 3, when my token moves, then it animates passing over the 'GO' space before landing on 'Baltic Avenue' (space 3).
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am sent to Jail, when my token moves, then it follows a special, direct animation to the 'In Jail' section of the board, not space-by-space.
technical_tasks: WI-007: Implement Player Token Movement
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. Token movement is smoothly animated and the camera follows the action. The 'Pass Go' and 'Go to Jail' scenarios are handled with distinct animations. Movement speed respects game settings. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Receive an extra turn after rolling doubles
description: As a Player, I want to be granted an additional turn after I roll doubles, so that the game correctly follows the official Monopoly rules.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am not in jail and I roll doubles, when my first move is complete, then it remains my turn and the 'Roll Dice' button is re-enabled.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I have just rolled doubles to get out of jail, when my move is complete, then my turn ends and I am NOT granted an extra turn.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I roll a non-double after having rolled a double, when my move is complete, then my turn ends and play passes to the next player.
technical_tasks: WI-006: Implement Secure Dice Rolling
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. An extra turn is correctly granted for a standard doubles roll. The 'get out of jail' exception is correctly handled. The consecutive doubles counter is tracked. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Be sent to jail for rolling three consecutive doubles
description: As a Player, I want the game to automatically send my token to jail if I roll three consecutive doubles in a single turn, so that the official rules are correctly enforced.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I have already rolled doubles twice in a row, when I roll doubles for a third time, then my token is immediately moved directly to the 'In Jail' space and my turn ends.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I roll my third consecutive double, when my token is sent to jail, then I do not move the number of spaces shown on the dice.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am on 'Boardwalk' and roll a third consecutive double, when I am sent to jail, then I do not collect the $200 'GO' salary.
technical_tasks: WI-006: Implement Secure Dice Rolling
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. Player is sent to jail on the third consecutive double. The token does not move the rolled amount. No 'Pass Go' salary is awarded. The consecutive doubles counter is reset. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Collect $200 salary when passing or landing on GO
description: As a Player, I want to automatically be credited with a $200 salary when my token passes or lands on the GO space, so that the game follows the official rules.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given my token is on 'Boardwalk' (space 39) and my cash is $500, when I roll a 5 and my token moves past GO, then my cash balance is automatically increased to $700.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given my token is on 'Park Place' (space 37) and I roll a 3, when my token lands exactly on GO, then my cash balance is automatically increased by $200.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am sent to Jail from a space before GO (e.g., via the 'Go to Jail' space), when my token moves, then I do not collect the $200 salary.
technical_tasks: WI-007: Implement Player Token Movement
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. Salary is correctly awarded for both passing and landing on GO. No salary is awarded for any 'Go to Jail' action that crosses the GO space. The HUD updates immediately. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Get out of jail by paying the $50 fine
description: As a Player in jail, I want the option to pay a $50 fine at the start of my turn, so that I can get out immediately and continue my turn normally.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am in jail and have more than $50, when my turn begins, then a dialog is presented with an enabled 'Pay $50 Fine' option.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I select the 'Pay $50 Fine' option, when I confirm, then my cash is reduced by $50, my status is set to 'Active', and I can proceed with a normal turn (roll, move, etc.).
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am in jail and have less than $50, when my turn begins, then the 'Pay $50 Fine' option in the dialog is disabled.
technical_tasks: WI-008: Implement Jail Mechanics
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The option to pay is presented correctly. Paying the fine successfully releases the player and deducts the correct amount. The option is disabled with insufficient funds. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Use a 'Get Out of Jail Free' card
description: As a Player in jail, I want the option to use a 'Get Out of Jail Free' card, so that I can get out immediately without spending money or risking a roll.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am in jail and have a 'Get Out of Jail Free' card, when my turn begins, then the jail options dialog includes an enabled 'Use Card' option.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I choose to use my 'Get Out of Jail Free' card, when I confirm, then my card count is decremented by one, my status becomes 'Active', and I can proceed with a normal turn.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I have used my card, when the action is complete, then the card is returned to the bottom of its original deck (Chance or Community Chest).
technical_tasks: WI-008: Implement Jail Mechanics; WI-009: Implement Card Deck Mechanics
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The 'Use Card' option is available only when a card is held. Using the card correctly updates player state and returns the card to the correct deck. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Attempt to get out of jail by rolling for doubles
description: As a Player in jail, I want the option to roll for doubles on my turn, so that I can attempt to get out for free.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am in jail, when I select the 'Roll for Doubles' option and the result is doubles, then my status becomes 'Active', I move the number of spaces rolled, and my turn ends (without an extra turn).
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am in jail, when I select the 'Roll for Doubles' option and the result is NOT doubles, then my turn immediately ends and my 'jail turns remaining' counter is decremented.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am in jail, when my turn starts, then a modal UI dialog is presented with all available jail options, including 'Roll for Doubles'.
technical_tasks: WI-008: Implement Jail Mechanics
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. Successfully rolling doubles releases the player but does not grant an extra turn. Failing to roll doubles ends the turn. The correct UI is presented. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Be forced to pay the fine after failing to get out of jail
description: As a Player in jail, if I fail to roll doubles on my third attempt, I want the game to automatically force me to pay the $50 fine, so that the official rules are enforced and my turn can proceed.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am in jail and have failed to roll doubles for two consecutive turns, when I roll for a third time and fail again, then I am automatically charged a $50 fine.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I have been forced to pay the fine after the third roll, when the payment is complete, then my token moves the number of spaces shown on that third roll and my turn ends.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am forced to pay the $50 fine but have insufficient cash, when the payment is attempted, then the game prompts me to raise funds (mortgage/sell) or enter bankruptcy.
technical_tasks: WI-008: Implement Jail Mechanics
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The fine is automatically paid on the third failed roll. The player then moves according to that roll. The bankruptcy flow is correctly triggered if the fine cannot be paid. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Draw a Chance card
description: As a Player, I want the game to automatically draw a Chance card when I land on a Chance space, so that the game follows the official rules and introduces random events.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I land on a Chance space, when my movement ends, then a UI element displays the top card from the shuffled Chance deck and its effect is automatically applied.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I draw a standard Chance card, when its action is complete, then the card is placed at the bottom of the Chance deck.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I draw the 'Get Out of Jail Free' card from the Chance deck, when the action is complete, then the card is added to my inventory and is NOT returned to the deck.
technical_tasks: WI-009: Implement Card Deck Mechanics
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. All 16 Chance card effects are implemented correctly. The deck is shuffled and cards are cycled correctly. The 'Get Out of Jail Free' card is handled as a special case. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Draw a Community Chest card
description: As a Player, I want the game to automatically draw a Community Chest card when I land on a Community Chest space, so that the game follows the official rules and the game state is updated accordingly.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I land on a Community Chest space, when my movement ends, then a UI element displays the top card from the shuffled Community Chest deck and its effect is automatically applied.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I draw a standard Community Chest card, when its action is complete, then the card is placed at the bottom of the Community Chest deck.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I draw the 'Get Out of Jail Free' card from the Community Chest deck, when the action is complete, then the card is added to my inventory and is NOT returned to the deck.
technical_tasks: WI-009: Implement Card Deck Mechanics
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. All 16 Community Chest card effects are implemented correctly. The deck is shuffled and cards are cycled correctly. The 'Get Out of Jail Free' card is handled as a special case. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Choose to pay $200 or 10% for Income Tax
description: As a Player, when I land on the Income Tax space, I want to be presented with a choice to pay either a flat $200 or 10% of my total net worth, so that I can make the most strategic financial decision.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I land on the Income Tax space, when my move ends, then a modal dialog appears pausing the game and presenting two options: 'Pay $200' and 'Pay 10%'.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the Income Tax dialog is displayed, when I view the 10% option, then the correctly calculated cash value is displayed (e.g., 'Pay 10% ($185)').
acceptance_criteria_3: Given my total net worth is $2500, when I select the '$200' option, then my cash is reduced by $200 and my turn ends.
technical_tasks: WI-004: Implement Core Rule Engine Service
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The dialog with the two choices is presented. The 10% net worth calculation is accurate. The correct amount is deducted based on the player's choice. Bankruptcy flow is triggered if payment cannot be made. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Pay a fixed Luxury Tax amount
description: As a Player, I want the game to automatically deduct the fixed Luxury Tax amount from my cash when I land on that space, so that the game correctly follows the official rules.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I land on the Luxury Tax space with sufficient funds, when my move ends, then the fixed tax amount is automatically deducted from my cash and my turn ends.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I land on the Luxury Tax space, when the payment is processed, then a clear notification ('Paid Luxury Tax: $100') is displayed and the transaction is logged.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I land on the Luxury Tax space with insufficient funds, when the payment is attempted, then the game prompts me to raise funds or I am declared bankrupt.
technical_tasks: WI-004: Implement Core Rule Engine Service
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The correct fixed amount is deducted automatically. A clear notification is shown. The bankruptcy flow is correctly triggered if the tax cannot be paid. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Experience no effect when landing on Free Parking
description: As a Player, I want landing on the Free Parking space to have no special effect, so that the game adheres to the official Monopoly rules.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I land on the Free Parking space, when my move ends, then my cash balance remains unchanged and no action prompt is displayed.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I land on Free Parking without rolling doubles, when the action (or lack thereof) is resolved, then my turn immediately ends.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I pass GO on the way to landing on Free Parking, when my move ends, then I correctly receive my $200 salary before my turn concludes.
technical_tasks: WI-004: Implement Core Rule Engine Service
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. Landing on Free Parking results in no change to player state. Turn progression (ending the turn or granting an extra turn for doubles) is handled correctly. Interaction with the 'Pass Go' rule is correct. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Manage my properties before rolling the dice
description: As a strategic player, I want a dedicated phase at the start of my turn to manage my properties (build, mortgage, trade) before I roll the dice, so that I can proactively adjust my financial position.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given it is the start of my turn and I am not in jail, when control is passed to me, then the 'Roll Dice' button is enabled, but the game waits for me to click it.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am in the pre-roll phase, when I view the UI, then all property management options (e.g., 'Manage Properties', 'Propose Trade') are enabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am in the pre-roll phase, when I click the 'Roll Dice' button, then the property management options become disabled and the game proceeds to the movement phase.
technical_tasks: WI-004: Implement Core Rule Engine Service
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The game correctly waits for player input before rolling. All management actions are available pre-roll. Management actions are correctly disabled post-roll. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Buy an unowned property I land on
description: As a Player, when I land on an unowned property, I want the option to purchase it for its listed price, so that I can acquire assets and build monopolies.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I land on an unowned property I can afford, when my move ends, then a modal dialog appears with the property details and an enabled 'Buy' button.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the purchase dialog is open and I click 'Buy', when the transaction completes, then the list price is deducted from my cash, the property is added to my portfolio, and the board is visually updated to show my ownership.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I land on an unowned property I cannot afford, when the purchase dialog appears, then the 'Buy' button is disabled.
technical_tasks: WI-010: Implement Property Purchase and Auction
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The purchase dialog appears with correct data. The 'Buy' button state correctly reflects affordability. A successful purchase updates the game state and visuals correctly. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Send an unowned property to auction
description: As a Player, when I land on an unowned property, I want the option to decline the purchase and send it to auction, so that I can try to acquire it for a lower price or force opponents to spend cash.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I land on an unowned property, when the purchase dialog appears, then an 'Auction' button is available.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the purchase dialog is displayed, when I click the 'Auction' button, then the dialog closes and the auction process for that property begins immediately.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I land on a property I cannot afford, when the purchase dialog appears, then the 'Buy' button is disabled but the 'Auction' button remains enabled.
technical_tasks: WI-010: Implement Property Purchase and Auction
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The 'Auction' button is always available on the purchase prompt. Clicking it successfully triggers the auction sequence for the correct property. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Participate in a property auction
description: As a Player, I want to participate in a turn-based auction for an unowned property, placing bids against AI opponents, so that I can strategically acquire properties.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given an auction is in progress, when it is my turn to bid, then a UI is displayed showing the property, current high bid, and options to 'Place Bid' or 'Withdraw'.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am the highest bidder and all other players have withdrawn, when the auction ends, then the winning bid amount is deducted from my cash and I gain ownership of the property.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the current high bid is $200 and I only have $199 cash, when it is my turn to bid, then the 'Place Bid' option is disabled.
technical_tasks: WI-010: Implement Property Purchase and Auction
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The auction UI is clear and functional. The bidding process follows the correct clockwise order. The winner pays the correct amount and receives the property. Bidding is constrained by available cash. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Build houses on a complete color set
description: As a Player who owns a complete color set, I want to purchase and build houses on those properties, so that I can increase the rent value.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I own a complete, unmortgaged monopoly and have sufficient cash, when I choose to build a house on a property in that set, then my cash is reduced by the house cost and a house is added to the property.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I own only two of the three properties in a color set, when I view my properties, then the option to build houses on them is disabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I attempt to build a house but the bank has no houses available, when I try to build, then the action is blocked and a notification informs me of the shortage.
technical_tasks: WI-011: Implement Building and Development Rules
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. Building is only possible on unmortgaged monopolies. The transaction correctly updates player cash and property state. The system correctly blocks building if prerequisites (monopoly, cash, bank supply) are not met. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Enforce even building rule for property development
description: As a Player, I want the game to enforce the 'even building' rule when I develop properties, so that the game is fair and follows official rules.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I own a monopoly where Property A has 1 house and Properties B and C have 0 houses, when I attempt to build a second house on Property A, then the action is blocked and the UI explains the rule.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I own a monopoly where every property has 1 house, when I attempt to build a second house on any of them, then the action is successful.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I own a monopoly where Property A has 3 houses and Property B has 2, when I attempt to sell a house from Property B, then the action is blocked and the UI indicates I must sell from Property A first.
technical_tasks: WI-011: Implement Building and Development Rules
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The even-building rule is strictly enforced for both purchasing and selling houses. UI feedback clearly explains why an action is blocked. The rule is correctly applied to monopolies of different sizes. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Upgrade four houses to a single hotel
description: As a Player, I want to upgrade a property with four houses to a single hotel, so that I can charge the maximum possible rent.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I own a monopoly where every property has exactly 4 houses and I have sufficient cash, when I choose to build a hotel on one property, then my cash is reduced by the hotel cost, 4 houses are returned to the bank, 1 hotel is removed from the bank, and the property is upgraded.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I own a monopoly where one property has 4 houses but another has only 3, when I view the property with 4 houses, then the option to build a hotel is disabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am eligible to build a hotel but the bank has no hotels left, when I attempt to build, then the action is blocked and a notification informs me of the shortage.
technical_tasks: WI-011: Implement Building and Development Rules
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. A hotel can only be built when all properties in a set have 4 houses. The transaction correctly updates player cash, bank inventory (houses and hotels), and property state. The system correctly checks for bank supply. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Be notified of a building shortage
description: As a Player, I want to receive a clear notification if I am unable to build because the bank has run out of houses or hotels, so that I understand the game state.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the bank has 0 houses remaining, when I attempt to purchase a house, then the action is prevented and a notification appears stating 'Cannot build: No houses available in the bank'.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the bank's supply of houses is 0, when I view my properties in the management interface, then the 'Build House' buttons for all eligible properties are disabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the house supply was 0 but an opponent sells houses back to the bank, when I view my properties on my next turn, then the 'Build House' buttons are re-enabled.
technical_tasks: WI-011: Implement Building and Development Rules
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The game prevents building when supply is zero and provides a clear notification. The UI dynamically enables/disables build buttons based on bank supply. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Participate in an auction for the last available buildings
description: As a strategic player, I want to participate in an auction for the last available houses or hotels when there's a shortage, so that I have a fair chance to acquire these critical assets.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the bank has only 1 house left and two players want to build, when a player attempts to build, then a building auction is triggered for that house.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a building auction is active, when it is my turn to bid, then an auction UI appears allowing me to 'Bid' or 'Pass'.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the game speed is set to 'Fast', when a building auction involving me begins, then the game speed is temporarily set to 'Normal' for the duration of the auction.
technical_tasks: WI-011: Implement Building and Development Rules
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The auction is correctly triggered in a building shortage scenario. The auction UI is functional and allows bidding. The game speed is correctly overridden for the auction's duration. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Mortgage an undeveloped property to get cash
description: As a Player, I want to mortgage my undeveloped properties, so that I can receive immediate cash to pay debts or fund purchases.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I own an unmortgaged, undeveloped property, when I choose to mortgage it, then my cash increases by the property's mortgage value and its status becomes 'mortgaged'.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I own a property with houses on it, when I view it in the management interface, then the option to mortgage it is disabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given an opponent lands on my mortgaged property, when rent would normally be due, then no rent is collected.
technical_tasks: WI-012: Implement Mortgaging System
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. Mortgaging provides the correct cash amount and updates property state. Developed properties cannot be mortgaged. Rent is not collected on mortgaged properties. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Unmortgage a property by paying principal plus 10% interest
description: As a Player, I want to pay to unmortgage one of my properties, so that I can start collecting rent on it again and enable future development.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I own a mortgaged property with a mortgage value of $100, when I choose to unmortgage it with sufficient funds, then my cash is reduced by $110 ($100 principal + $10 interest) and the property becomes unmortgaged.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I own a mortgaged property but have insufficient funds to pay the unmortgage cost, when I view the property, then the 'Unmortgage' option is disabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I have successfully unmortgaged a property, when an opponent subsequently lands on it, then rent is collected as normal.
technical_tasks: WI-012: Implement Mortgaging System
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. Unmortgaging deducts the correct amount (principal + 10% interest) and updates property state. The option is disabled with insufficient funds. Rent collection is re-enabled. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Initiate a trade with an AI opponent
description: As a Player, I want to be able to propose a trade to an AI opponent during my turn, so that I can strategically negotiate to complete monopolies.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given it is my turn before I have rolled the dice, when I open the trade interface and select an AI, then I can construct an offer involving my cash, properties, and cards for their assets.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am in the trade interface, when I attempt to add a property that has houses on it to the offer, then the property is disabled in the selection list and cannot be traded.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am in the trade interface, when I attempt to offer more cash than I possess, then the UI prevents me from submitting the trade and displays a validation error.
technical_tasks: WI-017: Implement AI Trading Logic; WI-020: Implement Trading and Property Management UI
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The trade interface allows construction of complex offers. The system correctly prevents trading of developed properties or more cash than available. The trade can only be initiated during the pre-roll phase. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Respond to a trade offer from an AI opponent
description: As a Player, when an AI proposes a trade, I want to be shown a clear dialog with the offer details so that I can make an informed decision to accept or decline it.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given an AI opponent proposes a trade, when the offer is presented to me, then the game pauses and a modal dialog appears showing what I give and what I get.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the trade offer dialog is displayed, when I click 'Accept', then the assets are exchanged between me and the AI, and the game resumes.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the trade offer dialog is displayed, when I click 'Decline', then the dialog closes, no assets are exchanged, and the game resumes.
technical_tasks: WI-017: Implement AI Trading Logic; WI-020: Implement Trading and Property Management UI
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The trade proposal dialog is modal and clearly presents the offer. Accepting the trade correctly and atomically transfers assets. Declining the trade cancels the negotiation. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Propose a counter-offer to an AI's trade proposal
description: As a Player, when an AI proposes a trade, I want the option to make a counter-offer, so that I can negotiate a better deal instead of just accepting or declining.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given an AI has proposed a trade, when I view the offer dialog, then a 'Propose Counter-Offer' button is available alongside 'Accept' and 'Decline'.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I click 'Propose Counter-Offer', when the UI transitions, then the main two-panel trading interface opens, pre-populated with the AI's original offer.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I have modified the offer in the trading interface and submitted it, when the AI responds, then I receive a notification of whether my counter-offer was accepted or declined.
technical_tasks: WI-017: Implement AI Trading Logic; WI-020: Implement Trading and Property Management UI
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The counter-offer option is available. The trading UI is correctly pre-populated. The player can modify and submit the counter-offer, and the AI evaluates it. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Be notified of AI-to-AI trades
description: As a Player, I want to see a non-intrusive notification when two AI opponents trade with each other, so that I can maintain situational awareness of the changing game state.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given two AI opponents complete a trade, when the transaction is finalized, then a temporary notification banner appears on screen summarizing the trade (e.g., 'AI 1 traded Boardwalk to AI 2 for $500').
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the AI trade notification appears, when it is displayed, then it does not pause the game or require any user interaction to dismiss.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the game speed is set to 'Instant', when an AI-to-AI trade occurs, then the notification is still displayed for its full duration.
technical_tasks: WI-017: Implement AI Trading Logic
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. A non-intrusive notification is shown for every completed AI-to-AI trade. The notification correctly summarizes the trade. The feature works correctly on all game speed settings. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Automatically collect rent from opponents
description: As a Property Owner, I want the game to automatically collect rent from an opponent who lands on my property, so that the rules are enforced fairly and I can focus on my strategy.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I own an undeveloped property in a monopoly, when an opponent lands on it, then double the base rent is automatically transferred from them to me.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I own a property with 3 houses, when an opponent lands on it, then the correct rent for 3 houses is automatically transferred from them to me.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I own a mortgaged property, when an opponent lands on it, then no rent is collected.
technical_tasks: WI-004: Implement Core Rule Engine Service
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. Rent is calculated and transferred automatically and correctly for all property types and development levels. No rent is collected on mortgaged properties. The bankruptcy flow is triggered if the opponent cannot pay. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Automatically pay rent to opponents
description: As a Player, I want the game to automatically process my rent payment when I land on an opponent's property, so that the game flows smoothly and the rules are enforced correctly.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I land on an opponent's property with a hotel, when my move ends, then the correct hotel rent is automatically deducted from my cash and transferred to the owner.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I land on an opponent's property, when the rent is paid, then a notification confirms the amount paid and to whom, and my HUD immediately updates my cash balance.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I land on an opponent's property and cannot afford the rent, when payment is attempted, then the game initiates the bankruptcy process.
technical_tasks: WI-004: Implement Core Rule Engine Service
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. Rent is calculated and paid automatically. The transaction is clearly communicated via UI feedback. The bankruptcy flow is correctly triggered when necessary. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: See a victory screen when I win
description: As a Player who has won the game, I want to be presented with a celebratory victory screen, so that my achievement is acknowledged and I feel a sense of accomplishment.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am the last remaining player after all AIs have gone bankrupt, when the final bankruptcy is resolved, then the game transitions to a modal Victory Screen.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the Victory Screen is displayed, when I view it, then it shows a 'Victory!' message and key stats from the match (Final Net Worth, Game Duration, Total Turns).
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the Victory Screen is displayed, when I interact with it, then it provides functional buttons to 'View Game Summary' and 'Return to Main Menu'.
technical_tasks: WI-013: Implement Bankruptcy System
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The victory screen is triggered correctly upon winning. It displays accurate summary statistics. Navigation buttons to the summary screen and main menu are functional. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: See a game-over screen when I go bankrupt
description: As a Player, I want to be shown a clear 'Game Over' screen immediately after I am declared bankrupt, so that I understand I have lost the game.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I incur a debt I cannot pay even after liquidating all assets, when I am declared bankrupt, then the main game view is replaced by a modal 'Game Over' screen.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the 'Game Over' screen is displayed, when I view it, then it contains a 'Game Over' message and a single button to 'View Game Summary'.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I have lost and there are multiple AIs remaining, when I click 'View Game Summary', then the game simulates the remaining turns at high speed before showing the final summary screen.
technical_tasks: WI-013: Implement Bankruptcy System
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The game over screen is triggered upon player bankruptcy. It provides a clear path to the game summary. The post-loss AI simulation is correctly initiated. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: View a detailed game summary after a match
description: As a Player who has completed a game, I want to be shown a detailed game summary screen, so that I can review the performance of all players.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a game has ended (win or loss), when I navigate to the Game Summary screen, then it displays a list of all players and their final stats (Net Worth, Rent Collected, etc.).
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am viewing the summary screen after a game, when I check the results, then the ultimate winner of the match is clearly highlighted.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am viewing the summary screen, when I am finished, then a 'Return to Main Menu' button is available and functional.
technical_tasks: WI-013: Implement Bankruptcy System
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The summary screen is displayed after any game conclusion. It contains accurate final statistics for all participants. The winner is clearly identified. Navigation back to the main menu is functional. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: View an in-game HUD with player information
description: As a Player, I want a persistent on-screen HUD showing the name, token, and cash for every player, so that I can instantly assess the state of the game.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a 4-player game has started, when the game board is displayed, then a HUD is visible with four panels, each showing a player's name, token icon, and starting cash.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given it is a specific player's turn, when I view the HUD, then that player's panel is visually highlighted to indicate they are the active player.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player's cash changes due to a transaction, when the transaction completes, then their cash total in the HUD updates in real-time.
technical_tasks: WI-019: Implement In-Game HUD
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The HUD displays correct data for all players. The active player turn indicator works correctly. All data in the HUD updates instantly in response to game events. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: See visual indicators of property ownership on the board
description: As a Player, I want clear, color-coded markers on each property space, so that I can instantly see who owns what and identify monopolies.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a player purchases a property, when the transaction is complete, then a visual marker corresponding to that player's color immediately appears on the property space.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player mortgages a property, when the action is complete, then the ownership marker on that property changes to a 'mortgaged' state (e.g., becomes greyed out).
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a property is transferred via trade or bankruptcy, when the ownership changes, then the marker on the board immediately updates to reflect the new owner.
technical_tasks: WI-022: Develop 3D Game Board and Assets; WI-023: Implement Gameplay Visual Effects
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. Ownership markers are correctly added, removed, and updated in response to all relevant game events (purchase, trade, mortgage, bankruptcy). The visual state for mortgaged properties is clear. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Interact with modal dialogs for critical decisions
description: As a Player, I want the game to pause and display a focused pop-up for critical decisions, so that I can make informed choices without missing important events.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I land on an unowned property, when my move ends, then a modal dialog appears, pausing the game and prompting me to 'Buy' or 'Auction'.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given an AI proposes a trade, when the offer is presented, then a modal dialog appears with the trade details and options to 'Accept', 'Decline', or 'Counter-Offer'.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given any modal dialog for a decision is active, when I attempt to click on any UI element outside the dialog, then the interaction is ignored.
technical_tasks: WI-008: Implement Jail Mechanics; WI-009: Implement Card Deck Mechanics; WI-010: Implement Property Purchase and Auction
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. Critical decisions (purchase, trade response, jail options, etc.) correctly trigger a modal dialog that pauses the game. The dialogs block background interaction. Responding to the dialog resumes the game correctly. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Access a dedicated property management screen
description: As a Player, I want to access a dedicated screen to manage my properties, so that I can efficiently view my assets and take actions like building or mortgaging.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given it is my turn before I roll the dice, when I click the 'Manage Properties' button, then a screen is displayed listing all my properties, grouped by color set.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am viewing the property management screen, when I select a property from a complete, unmortgaged monopoly I own, then options to 'Build House' are enabled (if I have cash).
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am viewing the property management screen, when I select an undeveloped property, then the 'Mortgage' option is enabled.
technical_tasks: WI-011: Implement Building and Development Rules; WI-020: Implement Trading and Property Management UI
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The interface is accessible during the pre-roll phase. It accurately displays all owned properties and their states. Action buttons (build, mortgage, etc.) are dynamically enabled/disabled based on game rules and player state. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Use a two-panel interface for trading
description: As a Player, I want a clear, two-panel trading interface that displays my items and the opponent's items side-by-side, so that I can easily construct and review trade offers.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I initiate a trade with an AI, when the trading UI opens, then it displays two panels: 'Your Offer' and 'Their Offer', along with lists of available assets for both parties.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am constructing a trade, when I click on my properties or enter a cash amount, then they are added to the 'Your Offer' panel.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am constructing a trade, when I add one of the AI's mortgaged properties to the offer, then it appears in the 'Their Offer' panel with a clear 'Mortgaged' indicator.
technical_tasks: WI-020: Implement Trading and Property Management UI
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The two-panel UI allows for easy construction of offers. All asset types (properties, cash, cards) can be added to either side. The UI correctly reflects property states (e.g., mortgaged) and enforces trade rules (e.g., no trading developed properties). Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Access an in-game settings menu
description: As a Player, I want to access a settings menu during a game without quitting, so that I can adjust options, save, or exit in a controlled manner.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a game is in progress, when I press the 'Escape' key or click the settings icon, then the game pauses and a settings menu overlay is displayed.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the settings menu is open, when I view it, then it contains options for 'Resume Game', 'Settings', 'Save Game', 'Load Game', and 'Return to Main Menu'.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the settings menu is open, when I click 'Resume Game' or press 'Escape' again, then the menu closes and the game simulation resumes from its exact previous state.
technical_tasks: WI-021: Implement Settings Menu
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The menu can be opened and closed, correctly pausing and resuming the game. It contains all required navigation options. The pause functionality is robust and works during any game phase. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Adjust the game speed
description: As an experienced Player, I want to change the game speed setting, so that I can reduce waiting times for animations and AI decisions for a faster-paced game.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am in the settings menu, when I select the 'Fast' game speed option, then all subsequent game animations (e.g., token movement) play at an accelerated rate.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am in the settings menu, when I select the 'Instant' game speed option, then all subsequent game animations are skipped, and tokens appear to teleport to their destination.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given my game speed is set to 'Fast' or 'Instant', when an auction involving me begins, then the speed is temporarily reverted to 'Normal' for the duration of the auction.
technical_tasks: WI-021: Implement Settings Menu
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The three speed settings (Normal, Fast, Instant) work as described. The auction override correctly slows down the game and restores the setting afterward. The setting is persisted in save games. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Adjust audio volumes independently
description: As a Player, I want to independently adjust the master, music, and sound effect volume levels, so that I can customize the game's audio to my preference.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am in the settings menu, when I move the 'Music' volume slider, then the volume of the background music changes in real-time.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am in the settings menu, when I move the 'Sound Effects' volume slider, then a sample sound effect is played at the new volume level.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I have set my volume preferences, when I close and relaunch the game, then my settings are persisted and applied on startup.
technical_tasks: WI-021: Implement Settings Menu
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The three sliders (Master, Music, SFX) function independently and provide real-time feedback. All game audio is correctly routed. Settings are saved and loaded correctly between sessions. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Reset my historical statistics
description: As a Player, I want an option in the settings menu to permanently delete all my historical gameplay statistics and high scores, so that I can start tracking my performance from scratch.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I have existing statistics, when I click the 'Reset Statistics' button in the settings menu, then a confirmation dialog appears warning me that the action is permanent.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I have confirmed the reset action, when the operation completes, then all my historical stats are reset to their default zero state in the database.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I have reset my statistics, when I navigate to the 'Player Statistics' and 'Top Scores' screens, then they both show the empty/default state.
technical_tasks: WI-021: Implement Settings Menu; WI-029: Implement Statistics Tracking and Persistence
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The reset function is gated by a confirmation dialog. The operation successfully deletes the relevant data from the SQLite database. The UI correctly reflects the reset state. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Delete all my saved games
description: As a Player, I want an option in the settings menu to delete all my saved games at once, so that I can easily clear out old progress.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I have existing saved games, when I click the 'Delete Saved Games' button in settings, then a confirmation dialog appears warning me the action is permanent.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I have confirmed the deletion, when the operation completes, then all files in the '%APPDATA%/MonopolyTycoon/saves' directory are deleted.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I have no saved games, when I view the settings menu, then the 'Delete Saved Games' button is disabled.
technical_tasks: WI-021: Implement Settings Menu; WI-024: Implement Game State Serialization
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The delete function is gated by a confirmation dialog. The operation successfully deletes all files from the save directory. The button is disabled when no saves exist. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: AI evaluates and responds to trade offers
description: As an AI Player, I want to evaluate trade offers from the human player based on my difficulty level, so that I can make strategic decisions to accept, decline, or counter-offer.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a human player proposes a trade to a 'Hard' AI, when the AI evaluates the offer, then it uses its strategic logic to determine if the trade is beneficial and responds accordingly.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a human player proposes a lopsided trade to an 'Easy' AI, when the AI evaluates the offer, then there is a higher probability it will accept the poor trade.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given an AI completes a trade with another AI, when the transaction is finalized, then a non-intrusive notification is displayed to the human player summarizing the trade.
technical_tasks: WI-015: Develop AI Configuration System; WI-017: Implement AI Trading Logic
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The AI correctly evaluates and responds to trade offers. The AI's decision-making differs noticeably based on its difficulty setting (Easy, Medium, Hard). AI-to-AI trades are communicated to the player. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: AI manages its properties and finances
description: As an AI Player, I want to make decisions about buying properties, bidding in auctions, building houses, and mortgaging, so that I can compete effectively against the human player.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given an 'Hard' AI lands on an unowned property that would complete a monopoly, when it decides whether to buy, then it will almost always purchase the property if it has sufficient funds.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given an 'Easy' AI has a monopoly but is low on cash, when it decides whether to build houses, then it may make a sub-optimal decision and not build, or build unevenly if the rule were not enforced.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given an 'Hard' AI is in an auction for a critical property, when it is its turn to bid, then it will bid aggressively up to a calculated value for that property.
technical_tasks: WI-015: Develop AI Configuration System; WI-016: Implement AI Property Management Logic
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The AI makes autonomous decisions for all property management actions. The quality and strategy of these decisions are clearly correlated with the AI's difficulty setting. AI decisions are logged for debugging. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Save my game progress to a file
description: As a Player, I want to save my current game at the start of my turn, so that I can exit the application and resume my progress later.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given it is the start of my turn before I have rolled the dice, when I open the pause menu, then the 'Save Game' option is enabled.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I select 'Save Game' and choose an empty slot, when the save completes, then the entire game state is serialized to a versioned JSON file in the '%APPDATA%/MonopolyTycoon/saves' directory.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I attempt to save in a slot that is already used, when I select it, then a confirmation dialog appears asking me to confirm the overwrite.
technical_tasks: WI-024: Implement Game State Serialization
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The save option is only available at the correct time. The system correctly serializes the entire GameState object to a versioned JSON file with a checksum. The overwrite confirmation flow works as expected. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Load my game from a saved file
description: As a Returning Player, I want to load a previously saved game from the main menu, so that I can seamlessly continue my progress.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I have a valid saved game, when I select it from the 'Load Game' screen and confirm, then the game state is perfectly restored to the moment it was saved.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am on the 'Load Game' screen, when I view my saved games, then each slot displays metadata such as the save timestamp and turn number.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a save file is corrupted or from an incompatible version, when I view it on the 'Load Game' screen, then it is marked as 'Unusable' and cannot be loaded.
technical_tasks: WI-025: Implement Game State Deserialization and Loading
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. Loading a valid file perfectly restores the game state. The load screen displays correct metadata. Corrupted and incompatible files are gracefully handled and marked as unusable. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Handle corrupted or incompatible save files gracefully
description: As the Application, I need to validate save files on load, so that I can prevent crashes from corrupted data and inform the user about unusable saves.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a save file's content does not match its stored checksum, when the 'Load Game' screen is displayed, then that save slot is marked as 'Corrupted' and is disabled.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a save file was created with an older, incompatible version of the game, when the 'Load Game' screen is displayed, then that save slot is marked as 'Incompatible Version' and is disabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I have a save file from a compatible older version, when I load the game, then the data is automatically and atomically migrated to the current version's format.
technical_tasks: WI-025: Implement Game State Deserialization and Loading; WI-026: Implement Save File Data Migration
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. Checksum and version validation are performed on all save files. The UI correctly displays the status ('Corrupted', 'Incompatible') and disables interaction. The data migration for compatible older versions works successfully. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: View a list of my top 10 victories
description: As a competitive Player, I want to access a Top 10 High Score screen, so that I can review my most successful victories and be motivated to beat my own records.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I have won more than 10 games, when I view the 'Top Scores' screen, then a list of exactly 10 entries is displayed, sorted first by Final Net Worth (descending), then by Total Turns (ascending).
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I have not yet won a game, when I view the 'Top Scores' screen, then a message is displayed indicating that no victories have been recorded yet.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the top 10 list is full and I win a new game with a higher net worth than the 10th place score, when the game ends, then my new score is added to the list and the previous 10th place score is removed.
technical_tasks: WI-028: Setup SQLite Database and Schema; WI-029: Implement Statistics Tracking and Persistence
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The screen displays the top 10 scores from the SQLite database, sorted correctly. The screen handles the empty state gracefully. New qualifying scores are correctly added to the list. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Export my top scores to a text file
description: As a competitive Player, I want to export my Top 10 High Scores list to a simple text file, so that I can share my achievements with friends.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am on the 'Top Scores' screen, when I click the 'Export' button, then a native Windows 'Save As' dialog appears, defaulting the filename to 'MonopolyTycoon_HighScores.txt'.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I have successfully saved the file, when I open the exported .txt file, then it contains a human-readable, formatted list of all the scores displayed on the screen.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the 'Top Scores' list is empty, when I view the screen, then the 'Export' button is disabled.
technical_tasks: WI-028: Setup SQLite Database and Schema; WI-029: Implement Statistics Tracking and Persistence
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The export function correctly generates a formatted text file of the high scores. The native save dialog is used. The button is correctly disabled when there is no data to export. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Change the game's visual and audio theme
description: As a Player, I want to select and apply different visual and audio themes, so that I can customize my experience and keep the game feeling fresh.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am in the settings menu, when I select a new theme (e.g., 'Futuristic') from a list of at least two options, then all visual and audio assets (UI, board, music, SFX) change to match the selected theme.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I have selected a theme, when I close and relaunch the game, then my theme selection is persisted and the game starts with the chosen theme.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I change the theme during an active game, when I resume the game, then the game board, tokens, and UI are all updated to reflect the new theme without requiring a restart.
technical_tasks: WI-022: Develop 3D Game Board and Assets
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The game includes at least two distinct themes. The theme can be changed at any time, and the change is applied immediately to all relevant assets. The selection is persisted between sessions. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Be notified of available game updates on startup
description: As a Player, I want to be notified when a new version of the game is available upon startup, so that I can easily find and download the latest features and bug fixes.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a new version of the game is available online, when I launch the application with an internet connection, then a non-intrusive notification appears on the main menu indicating an update is available.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the update notification is displayed, when I click it, then my default web browser opens to the game's official download page.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I launch the application without an internet connection, when the game starts, then the version check fails silently and no error message or notification is displayed.
technical_tasks: N/A
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The version check is non-blocking and handles no-internet/server-error states gracefully. The notification provides a direct link to the download page. The application does not auto-update. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: View the game's data privacy statement
description: As a privacy-conscious Player, I want to access a data privacy statement from the main menu, so that I can understand how my data is handled and confirm the game operates offline.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am on the main menu, when I click the 'Privacy Policy' button, then a modal screen appears displaying the data privacy statement.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am viewing the privacy statement, when I read the text, then it explicitly states that the game operates offline and does not collect or transmit any user data.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am viewing the privacy statement, when I am finished, then a 'Close' button is available to return me to the main menu.
technical_tasks: WI-035: Implement Localization Readiness
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The privacy statement is accessible from the main menu. The content is accurate as per requirements. The view can be easily closed. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Access a searchable in-game rulebook
description: As a Player, I want to open a searchable digital rulebook from the pause menu, so that I can quickly clarify specific game rules without leaving the application.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am in a game and open the pause menu, when I click the 'Rulebook' button, then a modal UI is displayed with the complete, scrollable game rules.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the rulebook is open, when I type a keyword (e.g., 'mortgage') into the search bar, then the rule list is dynamically filtered to show only entries containing that keyword.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the rulebook content needs to be updated, when a new version is released, then the rulebook text can be changed by modifying an external JSON file without recompiling the game.
technical_tasks: WI-035: Implement Localization Readiness
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The rulebook is accessible from the pause menu. The search functionality works correctly. The rulebook content is loaded from an external, structured data file. Code is reviewed and merged.

title: Start an optional interactive tutorial
description: As a New Player, I want to start an optional, interactive tutorial, so that I can learn the basic rules and controls in a guided, hands-on environment.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am on the main menu, when I click the 'Tutorial' button, then the game transitions to a dedicated, scripted tutorial game state.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am in the tutorial, when it is my turn, then UI elements are highlighted and instructional overlays guide me through actions like rolling dice and buying property.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I have completed the final guided action, when the tutorial ends, then a 'Tutorial Complete' dialog is displayed with options to 'Start New Game' or 'Return to Main Menu'.
technical_tasks: N/A
definition_of_done: All ACs pass. The tutorial can be launched from the main menu. It provides a scripted, guided experience covering core mechanics. The user can exit the tutorial at any time or complete it to proceed. Code is reviewed and merged.
